Package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns

Class PollingSingleTupleProducer

java.lang.Object
com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.TupleProducer
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.PollingTupleProducer
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.PollingSingleTupleProducer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operator
Direct Known Subclasses:
RandomBeacon
public abstract class PollingSingleTupleProducer extends PollingTupleProducer
Abstract pattern class for an operator that produces a single tuple periodically on a single output port. This class extends PollingTupleProducer by providing an implementation of fetchTuples() which calls fetchSingleTuple at the polling frequency. Sub-classes provide an implementation of fetchSingleTuple to set the tuple's attribute values.

If the operator parameter iterations is set then it is taken as the number of tuples that will be submitted. If not set or if sub-classes do not call setIterations() then the operator will run until the job is terminated.

      @Parameter(optional=true, description="The number of tuples to submit. Negative value or zero means continually fetch and submit tuples.") public final void setIterations(int iterations)
      Set the number of iterations.
      Parameters:
      iterations - Number of tuples to submit, -1 means submit tuples until the job is terminated.

    • fetchTuples

      protected void fetchTuples() throws Exception
      Call fetchSingleTuple(OutputTuple) to allow a sub-class to submit a tuple. Keeps track of the number of tuples submitted and if the number to submit has been limited then complete() is called to terminate the periodic call of this method, and then a window and final punctuation marks are submitted.
      Specified by:
      fetchTuples in class PollingTupleProducer
      Throws:
      Exception

    • completedTuples

      protected void completedTuples() throws Exception
      Complete the operator. Called when the parameter iterations is set and the required number of tuples has been submitted. Terminates the polling task by calling super.complete().
      If this operator is in a consistent region then before terminating the polling task, we must ensure all of the tuples have been processed, by calling ConsistentRegionContext.makeConsistent(). If a failure occurred a reset will have occurred and we must continue to send tuples as, as the count of submitted tuples will have been reset. Thus if makeConsistent() returns false then super.complete() is not called.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • fetchSingleTuple

      protected abstract boolean fetchSingleTuple(OutputTuple tuple) throws Exception
      Fetch the information for the tuple and set its attributes. Return true to submit the tuple to the output port, false to not send. Only submitted tuples are counted against the number of iterations.

      When in a consistent region a submission permit is acquired before fetchSingleTuple() is invoked and released once it completes.

      Parameters:
      tuple - Tuple to be submitted.
      Returns:
      True to submit the tuple, false to not submit.
      Throws:
      Exception
